Al Jazeera: US, Russia clash at UN meeting over ‘violent extremism’ in Africa  
The US is accusing Russian military contractors of interfering in Sahel countries’ internal affairs. 
The United States has accused Kremlin-backed Russian military contractors of interfering in the internal affairs of African countries and “increasing the likelihood that violent extremism will grow” in the Sahel region, which is facing increasing attacks, an allegation Russia denied. 
US Deputy Ambassador Richard Mills lashed out at the Wagner Group at a UN Security Council meeting on West Africa and the Sahel on Tuesday.   
Read more ....   
Update: US and Russia clash over violent extremism in Africa (AP)   
WNU Editor: All eyes are on the Wagner group .... Russian mercenaries from the Wagner group owned by a key Putin ally are stoking influence in resource-rich Central African Republic (ABC News Australia).
articles.title: US, Russia Clash At UN Meeting Over Africa

articles.description:
Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen meets head of Germany's parliamentary defence committee Marie-Agnes Strack-Zimmermann in Taipei © Thomson Reuters    
DW: Germany won't arm Taiwan, says senior lawmaker 
A leading German lawmaker visiting Taiwan says Germany will not provide the island with weapons and has not been asked to do so. China has warned that foreign politicians who visit the island are "playing with fire." 
A senior politician in German defense circles told a news conference in Taipei on Wednesday that Berlin had no plans to send weapons to the democratically-ruled island. 
Taiwan, viewed by Beijing as its own territory, has faced mounting pressure from China, which has been ramping up military, political and economic pressure to strengthen its claims. 
Read more ....   
WNU editor: Taiwan wants more .... Taiwan calls on Germany to help maintain 'regional order' (Reuters), and China is not happy with this visit .... China invokes Germany’s ‘painful’ past, slams Berlin delegation’s visit to Taiwan (AFP).
articles.title: German Lawmakers Visit Taiwan But Will Not Provide Weapons To Taiwan

articles.description:
Iranian navy ship / Wikimedia Commons   
Washington Free Beacon: Iran To Station Warships in Panama Canal  
Iran entering Pacific Ocean for first time Iran's navy is set to station warships for the first time in the Panama Canal, a critical trade route in America's backyard that has never before seen an Iranian military presence.
Rear Admiral Shahram Irani, the commander of Iran's navy, said on Wednesday that his forces will establish a presence in the Panama Canal later this year, marking the first time Iran's military has entered the Pacific Ocean. 
Iran in recent years has placed a greater focus on moving its military into Latin American territories as it strengthens relations with anti-American dictators in the region, most notably in Venezuela. 
Iranian vessels have docked more frequently in Venezuela as Tehran's hardline regime seeks to prop up dictator Nicolás Maduro. 
These moves are meant to provoke the United States and signal that Tehran has the ability to station its military apparatus a stone's throw from U.S. territory. 
Read more .... 
Update #1: Iran to Deploy Naval Forces to Panama Canal: Commander (Tasnim News Agency)  
Update #2: Iran planning to extend area of operation to Panama Canal: Navy chief (Tehran Times)   
WNU Editor: This presence in the Panama Canal, if it does happen, will only be for show.
articles.title: Iranian Warships Will Use The Panama Canal For The First Time Later This Year

articles.description:
A Taiwanese Air Force Mirage 2000-5 aircraft is seen at Hsinchu Air Base, in Hsinchu, Taiwan, on January 11, 2023 [Ann Wang/Reuters]   
Al Jazeera: China renews threat, warns Taiwan independence will be ‘punished’ 
China’s Taiwan Affairs Office said anti-China elements in foreign countries were ‘playing with fire’ on the issue of Taiwan’s independence. 
China has renewed its longstanding threat to attack Taiwan and warned that foreign politicians who interact with the self-governing island are “playing with fire”. 
A spokesperson for China’s Taiwan Affairs Office said on Wednesday that Beijing was recommitted in the new year to “safeguarding sovereignty and territorial integrity” and “smashing plots for Taiwan independence”.   
Read more ....   
Update: China renews threat against Taiwan as island holds drills (AP)
